title: Overriding View.MeasureOverride on a derived SKCanvasView does not set DesiredSize.Height
body:
**Description**

I have a class derived from SKCanvasView and I'm overriding View.MeasureOverride and find that the control's DesiredSize.Heightis is not being set after MeasureOverride.

- Details
The control has 2 properties, double Thickness and Orientation:
When Orientation is Vertical, MeasureOverride returns a Size.Width equal to Thickness and DesiredSize.Width is set.
When Orientation is Horizontal, MeasureOverride returns a Size.Height = Thickness and DesiredSize.Height is always zero.

The result is the control always has a zero height when orientation is Horizontal.

I've confirmed this behavior with StackLayout, AbsoluteLayout and my own custom LayoutManager.

**Code**

Size measured = child.Measure(availableWidth, availableHeight);
Assert child.DesiredSize.Height > 0

**Expected Behavior**

DesiredSize.Width and DesiredSize.Height are set Measure.

**Actual Behavior**

DesiredSize.Height does not get set and remains at zero.

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue: SkiaSharp.Views.Maui.Controls  nuget package version 2.88.3
- Last known good version:  Unknown
- IDE:  Visual Studio 2022 Version 17.7.0 Preview 2.0
